summary.seg: Emmanuel MS 236 is a collection of seven unrelated Greek fragments, except for the first item, which has come from an English cartulary in Latin dated around 1360.

Fragment VI comes from two quires of a 11th or 12th-century manuscript of Symeon Metaphrastes. Four out of five bifolia have been rebound separately, and a single folio has been bound with a bifolio. As for the text and the signatures, the original quires were quaternions and composed as follows:
quire λεʹ ff. 41, 48, 43, 46, 47, [44], 49, [42]
quire λϛʹ ff. 39, 45 (the third to the seventh are missing), [40]
The last fragment (f. 50) has been bound in reverse.

supportDesc.collation:
The fragments are bound by quires to raised supports:
16-1, 21+2+2, 38 |
42 |
52 |
6-76|
8-92|
102, 112, 122, 132+1, 142|
152-1

binding.p: Rebound with millboards covered with vellum. Each quire is bound to a raised support. The previous binding (18th century?), also of millboards covered with vellum, is kept alongside the fragments in a box.

history.acquisition: The date of acquisition is unknown.

recordHist.source: Description (2021) draws on M.R. James, The Western manuscripts in the library of Emmanuel College: a descriptive catalogue, Cambridge University Press, Cambridge, 1904, p. 134-136.

availability.p: Visitors to Emmanuel College who wish to consult Special Collections material are required to apply to the Library in advance of their visit. For information on eligibility and admission procedures see: Emmanuel College: Special Collections.

monogr.title: The Western manuscripts in the library of Emmanuel College: a descriptive catalogue
Catalogus codicum hagiographicorum graecorum Germaniae, Belgii, Angliae
Überlieferung und Bestand der hagiographischen und homiletischen Literatur der griechischen Kirche: von den Anfängen bis zum Ende des 16. Jahrhunderts
Überlieferung und Bestand der hagiographischen und homiletischen Literatur der griechischen Kirche

series.title: Texte und Untersuchungen zur Geschichte der altchristlichen Literatur

series.title: Studien zur Geschichte und Kultur des Altertums. Reihe 2, Forschungen zu Gregor von Nazianz

monogr.title: Verzeichnis der griechischen Handschriften des Alten Testaments

series.title: Bible. Old Testament. Supplementum. Greek. Septuagint. 1931

msItem.title: Cartulary of the lands belonging to William Goscelyn of Snettisham in Norfolk
msItem.rubric: f. 1r Carta Marie filie Iohannis filii Galfridi
msItem.incipit: f. 1r Sciant et cetera quod ego Maria filia Iohannis filii Galfridi de Sharn
msItem.explicit: f. 18v item apud Etonschorte .iii. acrae et dimidius apud Lorgelon. Waltero de Eton viii d. ad festum Sareti Michaelis

support.material: Parchment of medium thickness and quality.

collation.p:
The fragment consists of three quires:
Quire 16-1 ff. 1-5
Quire 21+2+2 ff. 6-10 a single folio and two bifolia bound to a single support
Quire 38 ff. 11-18

supportDesc.condition: There is mild water staining and there are some areas of dirt. Only a strip from f. 8 remains. f. 12 has lost the lower margin.

layoutDesc.layout: ff. 1r-18v A single column of 10 lines. 205 140

history.origin: The fragment was written in about 1360.

msItem.title: Fragment from an Octoechos
msItem.rubric: f. 19r Ἕτερος κανὼν στραυροαναστάσιμος Δεῦτε λαοὶ
msItem.incipit: f. 19r Ἐπὶ σταυροῦ ἀναρτηθείς ἐκουσίως χριστέ
msItem.explicit: f. [20]v ἐσιώπας δὲ χριστέ φέρων αὐτῶν τὴν παθεῖν θέλων καὶ σῶσαι ἡμᾶς ὡς φιλάνθρωπος

support.material: Parchment of medium thickness and low quality.

collation.p:
The fragment consists of one bifolium:
Quire 42 ff. 19-[20]

layoutDesc.layout: ff. 19-[20] A single column of 23 lines. 160 150

handNote.p: The fragment is written in a upright mixed minuscule, without marked variation in letter size and aesthetical efforts. The letters are mostly isolated, and ligatures are limited to those with epsilon.

decoDesc.decoNote: A section breaking in red ink on ff. [20]r and [20]v

history.origin: The characteristics of the script suggest that the fragment was produced not before the second half of 13th century.

msItem.title: Fragment of the Akathist Hymn, with lacuna, preceded by lectures from Genesis and Proverbs
msItem.incipit: f. 21r τὸν τόπον ὃν εἶπεν αὐτῶ ὁ θεός· καὶ ὠκοδόμησεν ἀβραὰμ θυσιαστήριον ἐπάνω τῶν ξύλων
msItem.explicit: f. 22v The folio is illegible. The last legible line reads as follows: Ἡ περιστερά· ἡ τὸν ελεήμονα ἀποκυήσασα· χαίρε ἀειπάρθενε· ὁσίων πάντων χαίρε τὸ καῦχημα· τῶν ἀ[θλητῶν

support.material: Parchment of medium thickness and low quality.

collation.p:
The fragment consists of one bifolium:
Quire 52 ff. 21-22

layoutDesc.layout: ff. 21r-22v A single column of 36 lines. 205 150

handNote.p: The fragment is written in an upright mixed minuscule, without marked variation in letter size. The letters are mostly isolated.

history.origin: The characteristics of the script suggest that the fragment was produced not before the second half of 13th century.

msItem.title: Fragment from a hagiography
msItem.incipit: f. 23r καὶ τῶ δήμω παντὶ τοῖς ]λευταῖς κουφισμὸν
msItem.explicit: f. 23r νῦν καὶ ἀεὶ καὶ εἰς τοῦς σύμπαντας αἰῶνας τῶν αἰώνων ἀμῆν

msItem.title: Miracles of saints Guria, Samona and Abib
msItem.rubric: ff. 23r θαῦμα γενόμενων· ὑπὸ τῶν ἁγίων ὁμολογητῶν· Γουρία· Σαμωνᾶ· καὶ Ἀβίβου· κύριε εὐλόγησον
msItem.incipit: f. 23r Νῦν καιρὸς. μετὰ τοῦ πνευματοφόρου προφήτου Δαυὶδ ψάλλοντας εἰπεῖν
msItem.explicit: f. 31v δοξολογία ἐγένετο πρὸς τὸν σωτῆρα χριστὸν· τὸν μὴ παρωρὸντα τοὺς εἰς αὐτῶν ἐλπίζοντας. καὶ ἐπὶ τὴν δύναμιν καταφεύγοντας. τῶν ἁγίων μαρτύρων· ὦ ἡ δόξα καὶ τὸ κράτος εἰς τοὺς αἰῶνας τῶν αἰώνων ἀμῆν

msItem.author: Gregory of Nazianzus
msItem.title: In Theophania (oratio XXXVIII)
In Nativitatem
msItem.rubric: f. 31v τοῦ ἐν ἁγίοις πατρὸς ἡμῶν· γρηγορίου τοῦ θεὁλόγου· ἐπισκόπου ναζιανζοῦ· λόγος εἰς τῆν χριστοῦ γέννησιν· κύριε εὐλόγησον
msItem.incipit: f. 31v Χριστὸς γεννᾶται δοξάσαται· Χριστὸς ἐξ οὐρανῶν ἀπαντήσατε· Χριστὸς ἐπὶ γῆς ὑψῶθηται
msItem.explicit: f. 34v ὁ διὰ τὴν λαμπρῶτητα ἐωσφόρος· σκότος διὰ τὴν ἔπαρσιν καὶ γενόμενος καὶ λεγόμενος. αἵ τε ὑπ’ αὐτὸν ἀποσ[τατικαὶ

support.material: ff. 23-34: Parchment, medium thickness, arranged flesh-to-flesh and hair-to-hair with hair outermost (HFFH).

collation.p:
The fragment consists of two quires:
Quires 6-76 ff. 23-34

supportDesc.condition: In fair condition. Some lines have been obliterated.

layoutDesc.layout:
ff. 23r-34v: written space 215 140
29 lines per page. Pricking does not survive. Ruled in hardpoint, type Leroy 20C1 .

handNote.p: The fragment is written in an upright mixed minuscule, without marked variation in letter size. Ligatures are in use but abbreviations are rare. Breathings are curved and do not join to the accents.

decoDesc.decoNote: A wavy line separates the texts.
Major an minor initials are decorated with a flourishing on margin.

additions.p: Greg. Nazianz. on f. 23r regardless the texts on the folio.

history.origin: The characteristics of the script suggest that the part was produced in the 11th century.

msItem.author: John Chrysostom (attribuited to)
msItem.title: Ad populum Antiochenum homiliae 10-11 (defective)
msItem.incipit: f. 35r φέρε ἐπὶ τὴν γλυκεῖαν ὑμᾶς τῶν γραφῶν ἀγαγόντες πηγὴν
msItem.explicit: f. [36]v πολλῶ μᾶλλον τὸν λέγοντα, καιρὸν ἐπιτήδειον ζητεῖν χρὴ
msItem.note:
The text runs as follows:
hom. 10: ff. 35r-35v, 37r-38r
hom. 11: ff. 38r-38v, [36]r-[36]v

collation.p:
The fragment consists of two bifolia, the second was inserted into the first and they served as the innermost leaves of the original quires.
Quires 8-92 ff. 35-38

supportDesc.condition: In fair condition. Some lines have been obliterated.

layoutDesc.layout:
ff. 35r-38v: written space 215 160
29 lines per column. Pricking does not survive. Ruled in hardpoint, type Leroy 24C2 .

handNote.p: The fragment is written in an upright mixed minuscule, in brown ink, and red ink for titles in Alexadrine majuscule. There is variation in letter size. Ligatures are in use but abbreviations are rare. Breathings are curved and do not join to the accents.

decoDesc.decoNote: A rectangular heapiece in red ink on f. 38r.
Major and minor initials are decorated in red ink.

history.origin: The characteristics of the script suggest that this part was produced in the 12th century.

msItem.title: Vita sanctorum Cyri et Ioannis
msItem.incipit: f. 39r τοῦτ]ο οἰκείοις ἀντιδοξάσαι μέλεσι. Ταῦτα ἐδεῖτο μέν· ἤνυε δὲ πλέον οὐδέν
msItem.explicit: f. 39v μετὰ βάλληι παραχρῆμα τῶ σχῆμα· τὸν βίον· τὸ ἐπιτήδευμα· καὶ κείρας ἐν χρῶ τὴν κε[φαλήν
msItem.note: the text continues from ff. [42]r-[42]v and on ff. 45r-45v

msItem.title: Vita sanctorum Cyri et Ioannis
msItem.incipit: f. [40]r μέγιστος· ἐκ τῶν πρὸς ἑσπέραν κινεῖται πόλεμος
msItem.explicit: f. [40]v (ἱε)ροῖς ἱδρ(ύμασί τε καὶ ἀναθήμασι) καὶ τέμενος

msItem.title: Hypomnema sancti Joannis Chrysostomi
msItem.incipit: f. 41r ἔχουσαν· τῶ οἰκουμενικῶ διδασκάλω καὶ πνευματικῶ πατρὶ Ἰωάννη
msItem.explicit: f. 41v καὶ ἠρέμα τῆς θαλάσσης ἐπιφριττούσης· πανταχόθεν ἀ[θροισθέντα
msItem.note: ed. F. Halkin, Douze récits byzantins sur saint Jean Chrysostome, Subsidia hagiographica 60 (1977), p. 482 line 22 - 484 line 3 ab imo

msItem.title: Vita sanctorum Cyri et Ioannis
msItem.incipit: f. [42]r ἡδονὰς λαθραίαις καὶ νυκτεριναῖς ἐξόδοις· ἀλλὰ μηδὲν τοιοῦτον μᾶλλον ἐθέλων παθεῖν
msItem.explicit: f. [42]v ἀλλ’ ὅπερ εἰς τιμὴν ἐκεῖνος ἐδείματο αὐτοῖς ἱερόν τοῦτο

msItem.title: Vita sancti Ephraem Syri
msItem.incipit: f. 43r πά]ση τῆ ζωῆ μου οὐδένα κατηρασάμην· καθόλου τὲ· οὐδενὶ τῶν πιστῶν διεμαχησάμην
msItem.explicit: f. 43v ἑάλω ἡ ἑλεῖν βουληθεῖσα γυνὴ· τὴν ἀπαθῆ ψυχὴν καὶ ἀνάλωτον· οὐδὲ τοῦτο γνῶναι δυνηθεῖσα
msItem.note: the text continues from f. 48v and on ff. 46r-46v

msItem.title: Vita sancti Ephraem Syri
msItem.incipit: f. [44]r τῆ ἐκείνου γνώμη καὶ ταῖς ἡδοναῖς δουλεύειν ἐλέγετο
msItem.explicit: f. [44]v καὶ τῆς σωτηρίας ἐπιβούλω τῆς ἡμετέρας· ἀλλ’ ἤ[δη
msItem.note: the text continues from ff. 47r-47v and on ff. 49r-49v

msItem.title: Vita sanctorum Cyri et Ioannis
msItem.incipit: f. 45r κεφαλήν· τὰ μοναχῶν ἀμφιέννυται· καὶ πρὸς ἀγωγὴν ὑψηλοτέραν ἀνάγεται
msItem.explicit: f. 45v τὰ χριστιανῶν αὐξάνειν σπουδάζετε περιϋβρίζειν δὲ τὰ καίσαρος μη[χανῇ

msItem.title: Vita sancti Ephraem Syri
msItem.incipit: f. 46r ὅ φησι σολομῶν· ὅτι ὀφθαλμοὶ κυρίου τοῦ ὑψίστου· μυριὀπλασίως ἡλίου φωτεινώτεροι εἰσὶν
msItem.explicit: f. 47v καὶ ταῦτα δυσὶ βιβλίοις συντάξας· γυναικὶ πιστεύει τινί ἢ
msItem.note: the text continues from ff. 43r-43v and on ff. [44]r-[44]v

msItem.title: Hypomnema sancti Joannis Chrysostomi
msItem.incipit: f. 48r ἀ]θροισθέντα πάλιν τὰ πλοῖα τὴν τὸ καλὸν ἐκεῖνω σῶμα· μετακομίζουσαν τριήρη προέπεμπον
msItem.explicit: f. 48v ἐνηχοῦσα· καὶ τὰ εὐσεβῆ δόγματα καὶ διδάγματα· διὰπρυσίως ἅμα καὶ μουσικῶς ἄδουσα· ἐν χριστῶ ἰησοῦ τῶ κυρίω ἡμῶν· ὧ πρέπει πᾶσα δόξα τιμὴ καὶ προσκύνησις· νῦν καὶ
msItem.note: ed. F. Halkin, p. 484 line 3 ab imo - end

msItem.title: Vita sancti Ephraem Syri
msItem.rubric: f. 48v Βίος καὶ πολιτεία τοῦ ὁσίου πατρὸς ἡμῶν ἐφραίμ τοῦ σύρου· εὐλόγησον πάτερ
msItem.incipit: f. 48v Ἐφραὶμ ὁ θαυμάσιος· ἔφυ μὲν ἐκ τῆς σύρων γῆς· ἑλόμενος δὲ τὴν ἀρετὴν ἐκ νηπίου
msItem.explicit: f. 48v οὐ λόγος ἄφρων διὰ τῶν ἐμῶν προήλθεν χειλέων· ἐν πά[ση

msItem.title: Vita sancti Ephraem Syri
msItem.incipit: f. 49r ἤ]δη μοι πρὸς τὸ τέλος ὁρ[ᾶ τὰ κατὰ τὸν ἐφραὶμ διηγήματα
msItem.explicit: f. 49v πρὸς τὰς ἐκεῖθεν σκηνὰς διὰβαίνει· καὶ τὴν ἐκδεχομένην τοῦ κυρίου λαμρότητα· ἐν χριστῶ ἰησοῦ τῶ κυρίω ἡμῶν μεθοῦ κράτος τιμὴ καὶ προσκύνησις πρέπει εἰς τοὺς αἰῶνας τῶν αἰώνων ἀμήν

msItem.title: Vita sanctorum Cyri et Ioannis
msItem.rubric: f. 49v Βίος καὶ μαρτύριον τῶν ἁγίων καὶ θαυματουρῶν ἀββᾶ Κύρου καὶ Ἰωάννου εὐλόγησον πάτερ
msItem.incipit: f. 49v Κῦρος ὁ περὶφανὴς τῶν μαρτύρων ἀστήρ· πόλεως μὲν ἐτύγχανε περιφανεστάτης
msItem.explicit: f. 49v ταῖς τῆς φύσεως ἀνῆκεν ὁρμαῖς· χαλινὰ πάντα χαλάσας οὐδὲ κλέπτειν εἵλετο· τὰς οὐ καλὰς

signatures.p: Signatures in Greek numerals in brown ink survives on ff. 41r and [42]v (λεʹ) and on ff. 39r and [40]v (λϛʹ).

supportDesc.condition: In fair condition. Some lines are obliterated.

layoutDesc.layout:
ff. 39r-49v: written space 240 170
35 lines per column. Pricked in outer margins. Ruled in hardpoint, type Leroy 24C2 .

handNote.p: The fragment is written in an upright mixed minuscule, in black ink, with titles in red ink. The ductus is cursive, and there is a moderate variation in letter size. Ligatures are in use but abbreviations are rare. Breathings are curved and do not join to the accents.

decoDesc.decoNote: Rectangular headpieces in blue, green and yellow ink on ff. 48v and 49v.
Major initials in the same style as the headpieces.

history.origin: The characteristics of the script suggest that this fragment was produced in the 11th or 12th century.

msItem.title: Isaiah 59:4-60:11
msItem.incipit: f. 50v ἀλη]θηνῆ· πεποίθασιν ἐπὶ ματαίοις καὶ λαλοῦσιν κενά
msItem.explicit: f. 50r καὶ διὰ ἔλεον ἠγάπησά σε· καὶ ἀνοιχθήσονται αἱ πύλαι σ[ου

layoutDesc.layout:
ff. 50r-50v: written space 270 165
40 lines per column. Pricking does not survive. Ruled in hardpoint, type barely visible.

handNote.p: The fragment is written in an upright minuscule, in brown ink, characterised by terminal thickening. There is moderate variation in letter size. Ligatures are in use but abbreviations are rare. Breathings are curved and do not join to the accents.

history.origin: The characteristics of the script suggest that this part was produced in the 10th or 11th century.
